title: gn.general topology - Conditions for a function to vanish almost nowhere on its support?
body: Let $f:\mathbb{R}^d\rightarrow\mathbb{R}$ be a continuous function and $\mathrm{supp}(f) := \mathrm{cl}\{x\in\mathbb{R}^d\mid f(x)\neq 0\}$ its support. Under which conditions is it true that $f≠0$ (Lebesgue-) almost everywhere on $\mathrm{supp}(f)$ ? (I.e., under which conditions on $f$ is the set $\{x\in\mathrm{supp}(f)\mid f(x)=0\}$ necessarily a Lebesgue nullset?) gn.general-topology real-analysis measure-theory geometric-measure-theory multivariable-calculus Share Cite Improve this question Follow asked Jul 6, 2020 at 20:54 fsp-b 453 2 2 silver badges 8 8 bronze badges $\endgroup$ 2 $\begingroup$ If the support is compact, this happens iff the support is Jordan measurable. $\endgroup$ Liviu Nicolaescu –  Liviu Nicolaescu 2020-07-06 20:56:35 +00:00 Commented Jul 6, 2020 at 20:56 $\begingroup$ @LiviuNicolaescu : Thank you.
